contentrichtext.text: Colonia '''Villa de Guadalupe''' (also known as La '''Villa de Guadalupe Hidalgo''') is a former separate town, now a neighborhood in northern [[Mexico City]] which in 1531 was the site of the apparition of [[Our Lady of Guadalupe]], the most renowned [[Marian apparition]] in the [[Americas]]. She can be venerated in the [[Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe|Our Lady of Guadalupe Shrine]], located in the ''villa'' (town). La Villa de Guadalupe is located in the [[Mexican Federal District]] within the [[boroughs of the Mexican Federal District|borough]] of [[Gustavo A. Madero]]. The town was founded in 1563, it was chartered as the city of "Villa de Guadalupe Hidalgo" in 1828. The [[Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo|Treaty of Guadalupe-Hidalgo]] which ended the [[Mexican-American War]] was signed here in 1848. ==External links== *[http://www.mexicocity.gob.mx/barriosmagicos/guiasBMT/Villa%20de%20Guadalupe.pdf Tourism guide to La Villa de Guadalupe, Mexico City government website] ==References== *[http://books.google.com/books?id=oT4zAQAAIAAJ ''La villa de Guadalupe Hidalgo: Su historia, su estadística y sus antigüedades'', Juan de la Torre, pub. 1887]</ref> *[http://www.df.gob.mx/index.php/component/content/article/80-cultura-y-turismo/615-villa-de-guadalupe "Villa de Guadalupe", Federal District website, retrieved 2013-04-17] ==See also== * [[1848 in Mexico]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1563]] [[Category:1563 in Mexico]] [[Category:1848 in Mexico]] [[Category:History of Mexico City]] [[Category:Colonial Mexico]] [[Category:Neighborhoods in Mexico City]] {{MexicoDistritoFederal-geo-stub}} {{Coord|19.485633|-99.116796|display=title}}
